PARAGRAPH.STRING: is a fourteener and the fifth highest mountain in the U.S. state of Colorado.

is located in the Sawatch Range in northwestern Chaffee County, approximately 20 miles (32 km) southwest of Leadville, Colorado, just south of Twin Lakes and Colorado State Highway 82 on the east side of Independence Pass.
is located completely within the San Isabel National Forest and
is part of the Collegiate Peaks Wilderness.

name means 'silver' in Spanish. This comes from the many silver deposits in the area. The nearby ghost towns of Winfield and Hamilton were prominent silver mining towns in the early part of the 20th Century. A Hayden Survey team first climbed
